At the beginning of the war (1939) the German military was larger than that of the US, or even the Russian military. When the Germans invaded Russia (1941) they had 3.8 million troops and the Russians only had 2.9 million, but two years later (1943) it was the Germans 3.5 million against 6.5 million Russians. In 1945 less than 1.5 million Germans were left to defend Germany against 8 million Russians. The American military only had just over a million in 1941, but by 1945 had expanded to 12 million
